justification: “NFC was assessed using the 16-item short form of the Need for Cognition Scale.”

“To assess perceived task load, we used the 6-item NASA Task Load Index (NASA-TLX), where participants evaluate their subjective perception of mental load, physical load, effort, frustration, performance, and time pressure.”
“We call it the Cognitive and Affective Discounting Paradigm (CAD)… this procedure allows to compute SVs based on actual individual preference instead of objective task load.”
construct: Cognitive effort discounting / Subjective value of task levels

justification: “At the end of each level, participants filled out the NASA-TLX … plus an item with the same response scale, asking them how aversive they found this n-back level.”

measured_by: n-back task (levels 1–4) with d′ and reaction time
justification: “The paradigm started with the n-back levels one to four… as a manipulation check, we hypothesized that with increasing n-back level the signal detection parameter d′ declines, while reaction time … increases.”
